org.lobobrowser.html.w3c

Interface HTMLOptionElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Element, HTMLElement, Node
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HTMLOptionElementImpl

    public interface HTMLOptionElement
extends HTMLElement
    A selectable choice. See the OPTION element definition in HTML 4.01.

    See also the Object Model (DOM) Level 2 HTML Specification

    .

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.w3c.dom.Node

    • Method Detail

      • getForm

        HTMLFormElement getForm()
        Returns the FORM element containing this control. Returns null if this control is not within the context of a form.
        Returns:
        the form

      • getDefaultSelected

        boolean getDefaultSelected()
        Represents the value of the HTML selected attribute. The value of this attribute does not change if the state of the corresponding form control, in an interactive user agent, changes. See the selected attribute definition in HTML 4.01.
        Returns:
        the default selected

      • setDefaultSelected

        void setDefaultSelected(boolean defaultSelected)
        Represents the value of the HTML selected attribute. The value of this attribute does not change if the state of the corresponding form control, in an interactive user agent, changes. See the selected attribute definition in HTML 4.01.
        Parameters:
        defaultSelected - the new default selected

      • getText

        String getText()
        The text contained within the option element.
        Returns:
        the text

      • getIndex

        int getIndex()
        The index of this OPTION in its parent SELECT , starting from 0.
        Returns:
        the index

      • getDisabled

        boolean getDisabled()
        The control is unavailable in this context. See the disabled attribute definition in HTML 4.01.
        Specified by:
        getDisabled in interface HTMLElement
        Returns:
        the disabled

        void setDisabled(boolean disabled)
        The control is unavailable in this context. See the disabled attribute definition in HTML 4.01.

        Option label for use in hierarchical menus. See the label attribute definition in HTML 4.01.
        Specified by:
        getLabel in interface HTMLElement
        Returns:
        the label

        void setLabel(String label)
        Option label for use in hierarchical menus. See the label attribute definition in HTML 4.01.
        Parameters:
        label - the new label

      • getSelected

        boolean getSelected()
        Represents the current state of the corresponding form control, in an interactive user agent. Changing this attribute changes the state of the form control, but does not change the value of the HTML selected attribute of the element.
        Returns:
        the selected

      • setSelected

        void setSelected(boolean selected)
        Represents the current state of the corresponding form control, in an interactive user agent. Changing this attribute changes the state of the form control, but does not change the value of the HTML selected attribute of the element.
        Parameters:
        selected - the new selected

      • getValue

        String getValue()
        The current form control value. See the value attribute definition in HTML 4.01.
        Returns:
        the value

      • setValue

        void setValue(String value)
        The current form control value. See the value attribute definition in HTML 4.01.
        Parameters:
